epidemic.progpracticum.model

Class Human

  • java.lang.Object
    • epidemic.progpracticum.model.AbstractEntity
      • epidemic.progpracticum.model.Human
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractEntity>

    public class Human
extends AbstractEntity
    The Human class represents a Human object that is a subclass of the abstract class AbstractEntity. A human can be healthy of sick.
    Version:
    Autumn 2013
    Author:
    Aaron Schraufnagel
    See Also:
    Point

    • Constructor Detail

      • Human

        public Human(char aSpecies,
     boolean aSick,
     int aDayNum,
     java.awt.Point aLocation)
        Parameterized constructor that sets the Human object's state to parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        aSpecies - is a character denoting the species
        aSick - is a boolean value denoting whether the human object is sick or not
        aDayNum - >= 0, the number of days the human object has been sick
        aLocation - is the location of the human object in the world, 0 <= x < world width, 0 <= y < world height
        Postcondition:“
        human object's state set to parameters passed

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Defines the way that a Human can move in the simulation world. A human can move between 1-3 spaces in a horizontal and/or vertical direction each timeslice.
        Specified by:
        move in class AbstractEntity
        Postcondition:“
        the human object moves to a new location
